{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Child Pugh score categorizes patients into three categories based on their scores: A, B, and C. These categories represent different levels of hepatic dysfunction, with A being the least severe and C being the most severe. Since the categories have a specific order and represent different levels of severity, the Child Pugh score is an example of an ordinal scale.", "answer_choice": "B. Ordinal"}
